intro: Bupleurum wenchuanense, commonly known as Wenchuan bugleweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
